Package fi.tuni.swdesign.group3

Class RoadDataHandler

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.swdesign.group3.RoadDataHandler
public class RoadDataHandler extends Object
A class which handles the fetching and saving of data from the two different APIs. Also provides the database for the program.
Author:
jukka, Aleksi Iso-Seppälä

    • saveDataBase

      public String saveDataBase(RoadTrafficData roadData, RoadWeatherData weatherData, DataQuery preference, String datasetName) throws IOException
      Method for saving the database containing the weather and road data, also contains a function call to savePreferences() since they must be saved with the datasets

      The DataQuery must not be null, but either of the RoadTrafficData or the RoadWeatherData can be null if only one of those needs to be saved. Only if you want to save both the roadData and the weatherData do you need to input both of those parameters.

      Parameters:
      roadData - , roadData object to be saved
      weatherData - , weatherData object to be saved
      preference - , DataQyery object to be saved
      datasetName - , name of the dataset
      Returns:
      "OK" if it works, otherwise it returns an error message
      Throws:
      IOException

    • loadDataBase

      public RoadData[] loadDataBase(String datasetName) throws IOException
      Method for loading the database from a json file. The function creates new RoadData Objects from the data in the json file. Has a parameter for the dataset name that was used when saving the database. If the name does not mactch, you will get a null value from the function.

      The return value is a list with RoadData objects inside. If the saved data had both RoadWeatherData and RoadTrafficData, you will get both of them inside the list. otherwise you will get a list with only one RoadData object

      Parameters:
      datasetName - , name of the dataset to load
      Returns:
      null value if unsuccesful, otherwise RoadData[] list containing the created objects
      Throws:
      IOException

    • savePreferences

      public String savePreferences(DataQuery dataQuery, String datasetName) throws IOException
      Method for saving the preferences for data visualization from the GUI. Creates a list to JsonFile so multiple datasets can be saved. Datasets are separated by the datasetName parameter.

      returns "OK" if the save was succesful, otherwise it returns the error message.

      Parameters:
      dataQuery - , object containing the preferences
      datasetName - the name of the dataset
      Returns:
      a String containing the status of the save
      Throws:
      IOException

    • loadPreferences

      public DataQuery loadPreferences(String datasetName) throws IOException
      A method for loading the user preferences for GUI. Loads the preferences from the json file. Firstly checks if the datasetName matches anything in the json file.

      Returns a null object if the loading was unsuccesful, otherwise returns the DataQuery object (which can be either RoadData, WeatherData or Combined Data object.

      Parameters:
      datasetName - A string containing the name of the preference
      Returns:
      DataQuery containing the preferences
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getHardCodedLocations

      public HashMap<String,ArrayList<String>> getHardCodedLocations()
      Method for getting the hardcoded locations which will then be added to the GUI
      Returns:
      ArrayList which contains the locations as a string

      Returns:
